intro: Reseda almijarensis, commonly known as the Almería Reseda, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. This species is characterized by its small, yellow or white flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in Mediterranean climates. The plant is typically herbaceous, with a low-growing habit and is sometimes used in local horticulture.
